title: Portrait of Mary Tarbell (Lady at Iron Railing)
credit_line: Gift of Margaret Ritchie R. Battle
provenance_text:
Edmund Charles Tarbell [1862-1938]. Sterling Strauser, Pennsylvania. Myron King, Nashville, TN [1]. Samuel Hardison, New York. T. R. Dunlay; R. H. Love Galleries, Chicago, IL, 1979 [2].  Geist Collection, Chicago, IL; (Sotheby's, New York, NY, December 10, 1981). R.H. Love Galleries, Chicago, IL, by May 1996. Purchased by Mr. and Mrs. Richard Mellon Scaife [1991-2007?], Pittsburgh, PA, May 20, 1996; transferred to Margaret Ritchie R. Battle [1947-], Pittsburgh, PA, by 2014 [3]; gift to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, June 2014. 
NOTES: [1] Myron King was the owner of Lyzon's Gallery in Nashville, TN. it is unclear if he owned this work, or if it was held by the gallery. [2] See "Edumund C. Tarbell and the Boston School of Painting; 1889-1980" by Patricia Jobe Pierce, page 219 for this provenance. This early provenance is under review. [3] Formerly Mrs. Richard Mellon Scaife.
